EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5) and a Dedicated Output Chest at (0.5, 2.5); transport belt routes mining output.
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection linking mining output to the feeder inserter.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5).
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5) transferring ore.
• Sink Chest – Wooden Chest at (-11.5, -46.5) serving as temporary ore storage.
• Sink Inserter – Burner Inserter at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5).
• Transport Belt Connection linking mining drill drop to sink inserter pickup.

### Automation Research Lab at (5.5, 5.5)
Consists of:
• Lab at (5.5, 5.5) conducting Automation research (currently needs additional automation-science-packs).
• Small Electric Pole at (5.5, 3.5) providing power connection.
• Steam Engine at (11.5, 7.5) successfully placed to generate power.
• Electricity Group connection linking the steam engine and lab via intermediary poles at (8.5, 7.5) and (5.5, 3.5).
Note: An attempt to place a Solar Panel at (6.0, 11.0) was made but failed due to its absence in inventory.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Placement and Inventory Management:
 – Ensure the required entity (e.g., solar-panel) is available in inventory before placement.
 – Always move close to the target location and use a buildability check to verify the area is unoccupied.

• Crafting and Technology Prerequisites:
 – Confirm that recipes are unlocked via appropriate technology research before initiating a craft (as seen with solar panel and logistic-science-pack crafting attempts).
 – Verify that necessary ingredients and technology requirements (such as solar-energy, optics, and plastics) are met prior to crafting or research.

• Research Dependency Management:
 – Validate that all research prerequisites are fully unlocked before setting a new research topic. Missing prerequisites (optics, chemical-science-pack, or plastics) will block progress.
 – Ensure proper sequencing of research to satisfy dependencies among technologies.

• Prior Error Prevention:
 – Initialize all temporary variables and entity references to prevent nil or undefined errors.
 – Check that target tiles are sufficiently spaced and unoccupied prior to placement.
 – Use entity attributes correctly and validate transport or power connections to avoid misconfigurations.
 – Monitor fuel levels on burner inserters and similar entities to sustain continuous operation.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset.  
  • Success: Entity is repositioned correctly.  
  • Failure: Prototype mismatches may occur if identifier strings are not standardized.

• nearest_buildable(position: Position) -> BoundingBox  
 – Determines the nearest buildable area surrounding a given position for entity placement.  
  • Success: Returns a valid bounding box for placement.  
  • Failure: Misuse of property access can trigger errors.

• place_entity_next_to(prototype: Prototype, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Optional[Entity]  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the given prototype adjacent to a reference position based on the specified direction and spacing.  
  • Success: Returns the placed entity.  
  • Failure: Returns an error if the target position is occupied or invalid.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
• mining_drill_drop (Position) – Stores the mining drill’s output drop position.
• target_chest_position (Position) – Represents the position of the attempted transport belt connection target.
